title: What does it take to get an S+?
body:
https://i.gyazo.com/575b68bc8a82c3ad7237ea211ca8c918.png

I mean, 24/0 is a decent score, I guess.

replies.body:
> [{quoted}](name=Talon12,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=NZE33lAi,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-05-15T10:11:00.521+0000)
>
> Really are a broken script

They deleted my thread for naming and shaming and I didn't name anyone.

wat.
names in video, so it is naming and shaming
I looked at the post that got deleted, there are summ names in the video, so yes, it's a name and shame.

The difference could be the _time._

If it took Seras Dragon 12 minutes to get that score, it's a lot more impressive than getting your score at 50 mins.

Neither of you have included the game time so we cant be sure, but it is a possibility.

That being said, personally I see no reason why your score shouldn't be a S+

In fact I see no reason why any perfect game with double digit kills should be anything less than S+

Actually, the difference is that I played it support, Galio was mid :P

As for why any perfect double digit score doesn't get an S, that just comes down to how high those top percentage of scores are for that champ, though I do suspect that CS is weighted differently based on your MMR, since while KDA doesn't change against people of equal skill, Diamonds are going to have better farm than Bronzes.
but the game was much shorter
